intro: Peperomia defoliata, commonly known as the velvet leaf peperomia, is a compact, evergreen perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Due to its slow growth and minimal maintenance requirements, it is well-suited for both novice and experienced plant enthusiasts.
